attributes.action: Hold a separate elections for Prime Minister and House of Commons.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM cannot be a party leader due to the head of the House of Commons would be the majority party leader, with two deputy heads from two of the smaller parties. A term will last 4 years. 

The House of Lords would also face an election at a regional level, with two people from each regional, similar to the senate in America, a term will last 4 years with a vote every 2 years. To be eligible you must have served as a local councillor for 10 years as a minimum, or served a term as an MP.
attributes.background: In 2020, I believe that someone who wishes to be elected as PM should be nominated. Those nominated would then face selection by the commons. Following this 5 candidates plus the previous PM would face a public election under the voting system "First-past-the-post". A term will last 4 years.
